questions.clue: This orange cartoon cat, known for his love of lasagna, was created by Jim Davis in 1978.
This feline character, from a Japanese media franchise, is often seen wearing a red bow and has no mouth.
This black cat, owned by Winston Churchill, was named after a historical British leader.
Featured in Disney's 'The Aristocats', this pampered feline's name means 'of the sea' in French.
Inspired by Japanese folklore, this cat-like robot from the future helps a young boy named Nobita Nobi.

categories.name: Slice of Life: Pizza Through the Ages

questions.clue: This Italian city is credited as the birthplace of pizza, where the classic Margherita was created in 1889.
This type of pizza is known for its deep-dish style and was popularized in Chicago.
In Japan, this pizza chain is famous for its commercials featuring cats as pizza chefs.
In 1984, this pizza became the first food item delivered to outer space aboard the space shuttle.
In 2017, this cryptocurrency was famously used to purchase two pizzas, marking a milestone in its history.
This famous thought experiment by Erwin Schrödinger involves a cat that is simultaneously alive and dead.
This 1960s experiment by Roger Sperry, which involved severing the corpus callosum in cats, helped advance our understanding of split-brain patients.
In the 1800s, this French physiologist used cats in his studies of the nervous system, leading to the discovery of the role of the cerebellum in motor control.
This NASA experiment in the 1960s studied the effects of zero-gravity on cats, leading to a better understanding of feline spatial orientation.
In the 1970s, this controversial experiment involved suturing the eyelids of cats to study the effects of sensory deprivation on the visual cortex.
This 1984 hit by the band The Pizza Cats is often played at parties and includes the lyrics, 'Extra cheese, if you please.'
In 2014, this internet sensation and feline celebrity released a parody song called 'Pizza's Cat,' based on a pop hit.
The band Pizza Rat released a song in 2020 that describes their dream of a world covered in pizza; its title is 'Pizza on the ____.'
This fictional band, The Pizza Cats, is known for their underground hit 'Slice of Life,' a song about the joy of pizza nights.
In a rare duet, the animated character Garfield and a famous cat band released this track, 'Pepperoni Dreams,' in 2021.
For $200: In Lewis Carroll's 'Alice's Adventures in Wonderland,' this feline offers cryptic advice and a toothy grin.
For $400: In T.S. Eliot's book 'Old Possum's Book of Practical Cats,' this mischievous cat specializes in stealing.
For $600: This pizza-loving cat from the 1980s and 1990s comic strip often dreams of Italian feasts.
For $800: In 'The Master and Margarita' by Mikhail Bulgakov, this giant, talking cat is a member of Woland's entourage.
For $1000: Haruki Murakami's novel 'Kafka on the Shore' features this talking cat who helps search for lost cats.

final.clue: This animated cat, known for his love of lasagna, once appeared in a comic strip where he hilariously attempted to make a pizza, inadvertently creating this now-iconic dish named after him.
